Description: Painted calcite reis shabti of Nehy with a black curled-lappet wig, a carved face with the eyes traced in black, a red and black collar, a tunic with pleated sleeves from which the low-relief crossed arms protrude, the hands hold two low-relief red hoes, the figure is shown wearing a kilt with a triangular pleated apron inscribed with a column of incised black hieroglyphs on a yellow ground within a red border, there is a column of black painted hieroglyphs running down one side of the kilt, the back of the legs are inscribed with Chapter 6 of The Book of The Dead in six rows of incised black hieroglyphs separated by incised red lines, the back is decorated with a representation of a red seed-basket(very faint), the backs of the feet are delineated in red.
